titles.title: Gädlä Qirqos “Vita of Cyricus” / Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus”

shortcontents.shortcontent:
I) Gädlä Qirqos "Vita of Cyricus" (fols. 3a-44vb) II) Täʾamrä Qirqos “Miracles of Cyricus” (fols. 45ra-71va): 12 miracles
Additio 1; colophon.

donors.donor: Zä-Mänfäs Qǝddus (the baptismal name of däğğazmač Säba Gadis or Säbagadis, b. 1780/85, d. 1831; s. EAE IV, 430-31) is mentioned in the colophon, in Additio 1 and in the supplication formulas throughout the Ms. (e.g. fols. 45ra, 47rb).

txstates.txstate: Quires 2, 3 and 4 are misplaced, possibly as a result of resewing.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the reddish-brown leather cover (at least 6 tools were used: cross hatching, double circle, triple line fillet, criss cross, double sine wave with dots, double crescent).

squires.squire: A(2/fols. 1r-2v) – ፩I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – ፬II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – ፪III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – ፫IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – ፭V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – ፯VII(8/fols. 51r-58v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 59r-66v) – ፱IX(6/fols. 67r-72v). Quires 2, 3 and 4 are misplaced; according to the text and to the quires marks, the correct sequence would be: A(2) – ፩I(8/fols. 3r-10v) – ፪III(8/fols. 19r-26v) – ፫IV(8/fols. 27r-34v) – ፬II(8/fols. 11r-18v) – ፭V(8/fols. 35r-42v) – ፮VI(8/fols. 43r-50v) – ፯VII(8/fols. 51r-58v) – ፰VIII(8/fols. 59r-66v) – ፱IX(6/fols. 67r-72v).

taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling (below on fol. 9r-v). The bottom line is written above the ruling.
A bottom ruled line has not been used by the scribe on fols. 52r-v, 57v, 69v-71r.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Distinctive features: conspicuously right-sloping letters, thick vertical stokes.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; names of the protagonists (Qirqos and ʾIyäluṭa); name of the donor. A group of lines alternating with black lines in the incipit page of Texts I and II; the initial lines of some paragraphs and some passages within Text I; the initial two lines of each miracle in Text II; Trinitarian formula; some corrections (words or letters) interlineally and over erasures. Elements of Ethiopian numerals, of punctuation signs, of text dividers and quire marks; marginal notes.

otherdetails.otherdetail: - In Text II, the miracles are not numbered.

desccontent.mss: EMML no. 430 (1922/32), fols. 104r-112v: “Combat of St. Cyriacus [Gadla Qirqos]” (EMML II, 150; Church of the Nativity, quarter of Lǝdäta, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 615 (1966), fols. 3r-42v: “Combat of St. Cyriacus [Gadla Qirqos]” (EMML II, 364; Church of Qirqos, quarter of Boleʾ, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 1934 (late 19th or early 20th cent.), fols. 29r-46r: “Martyrdom [gadl wa-semʿ] of Cyriacus and his Mother Julitta” (EMML V, 420; Monastery of Ḥayq ʾƎsṭifanos, Ambassäl, Wällo). EMML no. 2514 (1382/88), fols. 126r-133r (in the “Gädlä Samaʿtat”): “Martyrdom of Cyriacus and his mother, Julitta, [Qirqos wa-emmu Iyyaluṭā]" (EMML VII, 10; Church of Astit Kidanä Mǝḥrät, Ankobärr, Shoa). EMML no. 3469 (19th cent.), fols. 2r-20r: “Martyrdom [Gadl wa-semʿ] of Cyriacus and his mother Julitta”; fols. 42r-61v: “Martyrdom [Gadl wa-samāʿt] of Cyriacus and his mother Julitta” (EMML VIII, 283-284; Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yağğu, Wällo). EMML no. 4816 (1951/2), fols. 15v-59r: “Text of the Martyrdom” (EMML X, 324; Church of Däse Mädḫane ʿAläm, Wällo). Éthiopien 134 (15th cent.), fol. 28: “Martyre de S. Cyr et sa mère Julitta et des onze mille trente-quatre autres martyrs qui suoffrirent du temps du Tribun Alexandre” (ZotBNat 202). Éthiopien 339 = Griaule 35 (1932), fols. 1ra-28vb: “Martyre de l`enfant Cyriaques (Qirqos) et sa mère Juliette (ʾIyalouṭâ)” (GrébGriaule II, 3-9). Orient. 686 (1755/69), fol. 128r (in “Acts of Saints and Martyrs”): “Quiricus, or Cyriacus, and Julitta, ቂርቆስ፡ ወእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ (16th of Ṭӗr)” (WrBriMus 167, no. 257). Orient. 687/688 (18th cent.), fol. 200r (in “Acts of Saints and Martyrs”): “Quiricus, or Cyriacus, and Julitta (15th of Ṭӗr)” (WrBriMus 169, no. 258). Orient. 692 (15th cent.), fol. 84r (in “Acts of Saints and Martyrs”): “Martyrdom of Quiricus, or Cyriacus, and Julitta, ቂርቆስ፡ ወእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ (15th of Ṭӗr)” (WrBriMus 165, no. 256). Orient. 720 (1775/76), fols. 1r-109v: “The acts of Quiricus, or Cyriacus, ቂርቆስ፡, and Julitta, ኢየሉጣ” (WrBriMus 194, no. 297) Ṭanasee 121 = Daga Ǝsṭifanos 10 (18th cent.), fols. 218r-227r (“Gädlä Samaʿtat”): “ቂርቆስ፡ und seine Mutter ኢየሉጣ፡” (SixTana III, 93, no. 10). Ṭanasee 177 = Daga Ǝsṭifanos 66 (14th/15th cent.), fols. 57ra-80vb “Vita und Zeugnis des hl. Kyriakos und seiner Mutter Julietta (äthiop.: Iyaluṭā)” (SixTana III, 235).

literature.text: BHG, 111-112. BHO, 193-195. BudSaint II, 1130-1131. ColSyn IX, 106-111. A. Dillmann, “Über die apokryphen Märtyrergeschichten des Cyriacus mit Julitta und des Georgius”, Sitzungsberichte der königlich preussischen Akademie der Wissenschaften zu Berlin. 28. April. Sitzung der philosophisch-historischen Classe, Berlin 1887, 339-356. EAE IV, “Qirqos”. G. Fiaccadori, “Nuova iscrizione Greca da Aksum”, Parola del Passato 62, 2007, 70-76. J. Habbi, “Ciriaco (Quiryaqos) e Giulietta (Yolete)”, in: EncSan 491. T. Orlandi, “Cyriacus and Julitta, Saints”, in: CE III, 671. E. Sengal, “Poemetto amarico in onore di San Quirico”, Studi Etiopici raccolti da C. Conti Rossini, Roma 1954 (= RSE 4, 1944-1945 [1946]), 41-58.

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 3ra: In the name of the Father and  the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. Vita and martyrdom of the infant martyr mar Cyricus, and story of his mother Yulitta and of other 11,144 martyrs who were crowned during the time of the governor Alexander, because in the time of that governor there was a big persecution upon the churches of Cilicia.
desccontent.explicit: Fol. 44va: …ወናሁ፡ ማር፡ ሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሀለወ፡ ወትረ፡ እንዘ፡ ይቀውም፡ በየማነ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ሕያው፨ ወይተነብል፡ ምሕረተ፡ በእንቲአነ፡ ወበእንተ፡ ኵሎሙ፡ ኃጥአን።
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 44va, l.1: …and behold, the infant mar Cyricus is always present standing on the right side of  the living God, and he intercesses mercy for the sake of us and all the sinners.

desccontent.mss: EMML no. 303 (20th cent.), fols. 87v-108r: “Miracles of St. Cyriacus [Taʿamra Qirqos]; (EMML II, 4; Church of St. Raphael, quarter of Guläle, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 615 (1966), fols. 43r-47r: “5 miracles of St. Cyriacus” (EMML II, 364; Church of St. Cyriacus [Qirqos], quarter of Boleʾ, Addis Abäba). EMML no. 3469 (19th cent.), fols. 20r-26v: “Miracles of Cyriacus”; fols. 62r-69v: “Nine miracles of Cyriacus” (EMML VIII, 283-284; Church of Šäwa Meda Qirqos, Gubbalafto, Yağğu, Wallo). EMML no. 4816 (1951/2), fols. 59r-63r: “Miracles of Cyriacus” (EMML X, 324; Church of Däse Mädḫane ʿAläm, Wallo). Éthiopien 339 = Griaule 35 (1932), fols. 28vb-33vb: “Quatre miracles de l´enfant Cyriaque (Qirqos)” (GrébGriaule II, 3-9).

edition.text: S. Grébaut, “Les miracles du saint enfant Cyriaque”, ROC 18 (1913), 419-423; 19 (1914), 93-97; 20 (1915-1917), 106-109, 129-132; 21 (1918-1919), 409-411; 25 (1925-1926), 187-195. S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 33-36, 85-91.

desccontent.itranslation: Fol. 45ra: (Introduction) In the name of the Father and the Son and the Holy Spirit, one God. Behold, we wrote the miracles of the infant Cyricus in order that it would not be senselessness to the auditors who listen. May his prayer and his blessing and the help of his mother be with his servant Zä-Mänfäs Qəddus. For the eternity, amen. (Miracle 1) And there was a righteous king and priest who received the ordination from the mouth of his God in the saint region of Roha.…
desccontent.etranslation: Fol. 71va, l.10: (Miracle 12) … But the infant Cyricus, as he wished, revealed the magnificence of his power to the people who observed him with hope, and he expelled the guards from his house.
desccontent.details:
II-1) St. Cyricus and King in the region of “Roha” (fols. 45ra-46rb) (በስመ፡ʼʼ… ነዋ᎓ ጸሐፍነ᎓ ተአምራቲሁ᎓ ለሕፃን᎓ ቂርቆስ᎓ … ወሀሎ᎓ አሐዱ᎓ ንጉሥ᎓ ጻድቅ᎓ ወካህን᎓ ዘተወክፈ᎓ ሢመተ᎓ ክህነት᎓ እምአፈ᎓ አምላኩ᎓ በሀገረ᎓ ሮሀ᎓ ቅድስት፨ …)

(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 33-36 // Mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 59v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 28vb-30rb, GrébGriaule II, 4. The same miracle as in UM-008, fols. 23ra-24rb, in which the name of the king is Yəmrəḥannä Krəstos; the same miracle is in UM-009, fols. 84rb-84vb, and in AMQ-007, fols. 136rb-137rb, where instead of "Roha" it is written "Rome").

The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fols. 47rb-47va) (በደመ፡ ስምዑ፡ ተማኅፀነ፡ ለአርዌ፡ ሰማይ፡ ንማዖ፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ ሶበ፡ ንጼውዖ። እንዘ፡ ትብል፡ ተካየድከ፡ አልፋ፡ ወኦ፨…).

II-2) St. Cyricus and the monk from a remote region (fols. 47va–50va) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ ጸሎተ፡ … ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ መነኮስ፡ ምስኪን፡ ወነዳይ፡ እምርኁቅ፡ ብሔር፨ ወይትመሐፀኑ፡ በኪዳኑ፡ ክብርት፡ ወይትአመን፡…)

(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 85-86, 88-89 // Mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 60v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 30rb-31vb, GrébGriaule II, 4-5. Cp. also UM-009, fols. 85ra-85va).

The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 50va) (ሰላም፡ ለሕማምከ፡ ወለግፍዕከ፡ ብዙኅ፨ እንተ፡ ያብኪ፡…).

II-3) St. Cyricus and the sterile couple who was supplicating to the saint for getting a baby (fols. 50va-52rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወሀሎ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ እምአህጉረ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ዘይትአመኖ፡ ለእግዚአብሔር፡ በኵሉ፡ ልቡ፡ ወያፈቅር፡ ጾመ፡ ወጸሎተ፨ ወብእሲቱ፡ መካን፡ …)

(S. Grébaut, “Un nouveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 86-87, 89-90 // Mss. EMML no. 4816, fol. 61v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 31vb-32vb, GrébGriaule II, 5. Cp. UM-009, fols. 85va-85vb).

The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 52rb) (ሰላም፡ ለህላዌከ፡ ማእከለ፡ ሰብዓቱ፡ ነገድ፨ እለ፡…).

II-4) St. Cyricus and the monk ˀElyas (fols. 52rb-55rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወሀሎ፡ ፩መነኮስ፡ በዛቲ፡ ደሴተ፡ ፃና፡ ዘስሙ፡ ኤልያስ፨ ዘይትለአከ፡ ወትረ፡ በመዓልት፡ ወበሌሊት፡ በትጋህ፡  ዘእንበሰ፡ ጽርዓት፡ ለታቦተ፡ ሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ …)

(S. Grébaut, “Un noveau recueil des miracles de l`enfant Cyriaque”, Aethiopica 3, 1935, 87-91 // Mss. EMML no. 3469, fol. 22r, EMML VIII, 283; EMML no. 4816, fol. 62v, EMML X, 324; Éthiopien 339, fols. 32vb-33vb, GrébGriaule II, 5. Cp. also UM-009, fols. 85vb-86rb, and UM-008, fols. 35ra-36ra).

The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fols. 55rb-55va) (እግዚኣብሔር፡ ሤመ፡ ረድኤቶ፡ ለንስዕናከ፡ ዓቃቤ፨ ወስምዖ፡…).

II-5) St. Cyricus and the poor woman who was selling the water (fols. 55va-57ra) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወነበረት፡ አሐቲ፡ ብእሲት፡ ነዳይት፡ ወትሠይጥ፡ ማየ፡ ለሲሳየ፡ ዕለት፨ ወባቲ፡ ለይእት፡ ብእሲት፡ አሐዱ፡ ወልድ፡ ንዑሰ፡ አካል፡ ዘሠለስቱ፡ ዓመት፡ ወመንፈቀ፡ ዓመት፨…).

The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 57ra-b) (ሰላም፡ ለቂርቆስ፡ እንተ፡ ኢፈርሆ፡ ለነድ፨ ዘይሰማዕ፡ ድምፁ፡ ከመ፡ ነጐድጓ፨…).

II-6) St. Cyricus and the son of a presbyter of the church devoted to him (fols. 57rb-59va) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወነበረ፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ወአቡሁ፡ ቀሲስ፡ ውእቱ፡ ዘይትለአክ፡ ለቤተ፡ ክርስቲያን፡ ዘእግዝእትነ፡ ቅድስት፡ ወድንግል፡ በ፪ማርያም፡ ወላዲተ፡ አምላክ፡ ለዝንቱ፡ ወልድ፡ አቡሁ፡ ...).

The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 59va) (አመ፡ ተመከሩ፡ ሰብእ፡ በደዌ፡ መከራት፡ ክልኤ፨ ወተስፋ፡ ድኂን፡ ቀብፁ፡ መንገለ፡ ኃጥኡ፡ ረዳኤ፨…).

II-7) St. Cyricus and the governor in front of the King (fols. 59vb-62rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወኮነ፡ በ፩ዕለት፡ እመዋዕል፡ አስሮሙ፡ አሐዱ፡ መኰንን፡ ቅድመ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ለመንፈቀ፡ ካህናቲሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ መስተጋድል፡ በግፍዕ፡ በሐስት፨ ...).

II-8) St. Cyricus and the woman who had no husband (fols. 62rb-64vb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወሀለወት፡ በአሐቲ፡ ሀገር፡ አሐቲ፡ በእሲት፡ ነዳይት፡ እምንዋየ፡ ዝንቱ፡ ዓለም፡ ወመበለት፡ ይእቲ፡ ወትመከረት፡ በደዌ፡…)

(cp. Ms. UM-009, fols. 80vb-81ra).

The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fols. 64vb-65ra) (ኢተሐልዩ፡ ዘትብሉ፡ ወዘት ነብቡ፡ ከመ፡ ለቀደምት፡ ተጽሕፈ፨ እስመ፡ ዮም፡ ለክሙ፡…).

II-9) St. Cyricus and the great ruler who was imprisoned (fols. 65ra-66rb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … ወሀሎ፡ ፩መስፍን፡ ዓቢይ፡ ዘተወድየ፡ ውስተ፡ ቤተ፡ ሞቅሕ፡ በትእዛዘ፡ ንጉሥ፡ እስመ፡ ዝንቱ፡ መስፍን፡ ለዝንቱ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ወልደ፡ እሳቱ፡ ውእቱ፨...).

The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 66va) (ለመስፍን፡ ሙቁሕ፡ ብሥራተ፡ ፍሥሐ፡ ጊዜ፡ ንዋም፨ ከመ፡ አብሰርኮ፡ በሕልም፨…).

II-10) St. Cyricus and the strong wind from the west that destroyed the church devoted to him (fols. 66va-67vb) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት። … መጽአ፡ ዓቢይ፡ ነፋስ፡ በጊዜ፡ ስድስቱ፡ ሰዓተ፡ መዓልት፡ እመንገለ፡ ዓረብ፡ ወነሥአ፡ ተድባበ፡ ቤቱ፡ ለሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡…).

The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 67vb) (አስፍንቱ፡ አብያተ፡ ውቅሮ፡ እለ፡ ወድቁ፡ ወተመዝበሩ፨ ኀበ፡ ተዳደቆሙ፡…).

II-11) St. Cyricus and the sick man (fols. 68ra-69rb) (ንዌጥን፡ በረድኤተ፡ እግዚአብሔር፡ ክቡር፡ ወልዑል፡ ወበስነ፡ ሀብቱ፡ ጽሒፈ፡ ተአምራቲሁ፡ ወመንክቲሁ፡ ለሐፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወልደ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ ቅድስት፡ … ወሀሎ፡ አሐዱ፡ ብእሲ፡ ሕሙም፡ ዘኢይክል፡ ቀዊመ፡ ወየዓቅብ፡ …)

The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 69va) (አመ፡ ተመከሩ፡ ሰብእ፡ በደዌ፡ መክራት፡ ክልኤ፨ ወተስፋ፡ ድኂን፡ ቀብጹ፡ መንገለ፡ ኃጥኤ፨…).

II-12) St. Cyricus and the pagans who waged a war against Christians (fols. 69va-71va) (ተአምሪሁ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ … በአሐዱ፡ ዓመት፡ እምአዝማነ፡ መከራ፨ አመ፡ ኮነ፡ ድልቅልቅ፡ በበብሔሩ፡ እስመ፡ ጠፍአ፡ ንጉሥ፡ ራትዕ፡ ...)

(cp. UM-009, fols. 90ra-91rb).

The miracle is followed by a short hymn (fol. 71va) (መኑ፡ እምክህለ፡ አድኅኖ፡ እምእለ፡ ገብሩ፡ ልማደ፨ ፍና፡ ሰርከ፡…).

colophon.col: Fol. 44va l.7: ወናሁ፡ በዝየ፡ ተፈጸመ፡ መጽሐፈ፡ ገድሉ፡ ወስምዑ፡ ለሕፃን፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ሰማዕት፡ አምላካዊ፨ በረከተ፡ ጸሎቱ፨ ወሀብተ፡ ረድኤቱ፡ ወረድኤተ፡ ወላዲቱ፨ የሃሉ፡ [fol. 44vb] ምስለ፡ ገብሩ፡ ዘመንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ለዓለመ፡ ዓለም፡ አሜን፡ ወአሜን፨ ለይኩን፡
colophon.tran: Fol. 44va l.7: Herewith, the book of the life and martyrdom of the infant Cyricus, divine martyr, has been completed. May the blessing of his prayer and the gift of his help and the help of his mother be with his servant Zä-Mänfäs Qəddus. For the eternity, amen and amen. Let it be.
colophon.det: The colophon is followed by a short hymn (sälam lä-mälkǝʿka mälkǝʿa mädängäṣ mäläkot...); s. fol. 44vb, ls. 4-13.

additional.tran: Fol. 2v: This (is) the book of däğğazmač Säba Gadis, the governor of the governors and the prince of the princes, which he gave to the sanctuary of St. Cyricus of ˀAdd Grat, so that it might be the remedy for the flesh and soul. Amen.

extras.extra: - The title ገድለ ቂርቆስ is written on fol. 1r in red ink and in pen. - Corrections (words or letters) written interlineally: fols. 3ra, 8ra, 18rb, 27rb, 39rb, 66ra. - Erasures: fols. 14rb, 24rb. - Erasures marked by parallel lines over the word: fols. 14va, 22rb, 48rb, 49vb, 58rb. - Immediate corrections written over erasures on fol. 3rb. - Space left unfilled for the rubricated name of Qirqos on fol. 65rb. - Crude notes in pen or in pencil in the upper margin of fols: 64r and 69v and on fol. 72v. - Lacunae: fols. 24vb, ls. 1-2, 37rb, ls. 12-14.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: - Undecorated quire marks are written thrice in the upper margin (partly in the main hand, partly in a secondary hand) in fols.: 3r: ፩; 11r: ፬; 19r: ፪; 27r: ፫; 35r: ፭; 43r: ፮; 51r: ፯; fol. 59r: ፰; 67r: ፱.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Monthly readings are indicated by the names of the months written (in red, in frames or between lines above and below, in a secondary hand) in the upper margin: ምንባብ፡ ዘጥር፡: fol. 3r ምንባብ፡ ዘየካቲት፡: fol. 7v ምንባብ፡ ዘመጋቢት፡: fol. 10r ዘሚያዝያ፡: fol. 13r ምንባብ፡ ዘግንቦት: fol. 15v ምንባብ፡ ዘሰኔ᎓fol. 18r ዘነሐሴ፡: fol. 19v ምንባብ፡ ዘሐምሌ: fol. 23r ምንባብ፡ ዘመስከረም፡ fol. 25r ምንባብ፡ ዘጥቅምት፡: fol. 27v ምንባብ፡ ዘህዳር፡ fol. 33r ምንባብ፡ ዘታሕሣሥ፡: fol. 38v.

miniature.info: Fol. 4v: Julitta in front of the governor.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ይቤላ፡ እስክድሮስ፡[sic] ለኢየሉጣ፡ ስግዲ፡ ለአማልክትየ። “How (the governor) Alexander said to Julitta: ‘Prostate yourself in front of my god’”.

miniature.info: Fol. 7r: Cyricus being flagellated.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ተቀሥፈ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ “How Saint Cyricus was flagellated”.

miniature.info: Fol. 9r: Cyricus being tortured with mustard and salt put into his nostrils.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ወደዩ፡ ውስተ፡ አእናፊሁ፡ ሰናፔ፡ ወፄወ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ “How (they) put mustard and salt into Saint Cyricus’ nostrils”.

miniature.info: Fol. 10r: Cyricus being tortured by means of rods.
Fol. 12v: Cyricus and Julitta in prison.
Fol. 15r: Cyricus and Julitta being tortured by means of hot helmets (above); beheading (in the middle); Cyricus and Julitta being nailed (below).
Fol. 17v: Cyricus and Julitta being nailed.
Fol. 18v: Cyricus and Julitta being in a hot cauldron.
Fol. 19v: Cyricus defeating Satan and the governor.
Fol. 21v: Cyricus and Julitta in front of the governor.
Fol. 22v: The Angel of God demolishing the simulacra.
Fol. 24v: Cyricus in front of the governor.
Fol. 25v: Cyricus and the meat multiplied by him.
Fol. 27v: Cyricus’ tongue being cut.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ተመትረ፡ ልሳኑ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ “How Saint Cyricus’ tongue was cut”.

miniature.info: Fol. 32v: Cyricus praying on his mother (above); Cyricus and Julitta saved from the flames (below).
miniature.details: Legend (above, left): ዘከመ፡ ጸለየ፡ ቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ በእንተ፡ እሙ፡ “How Saint Cyricus prayed on his mother”. Legend (above, right): ዘከመ፡ ወረደ፡ መንፈስ፡ ቅዱስ፡ በአምሳለ፡ ርግብ፡ በላዕለ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ “How the Holy Spirit with the aspect of dove descended on Julitta”.

miniature.info: Fol. 36v: Julitta and the infant Cyricus (above); Cyricus and Julitta in front of the governor.
Fol. 38r: Cyricus and the governor whose neck was in pain.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ቈስለ፡ ክሣዱ፡ ለእስክድሮስ፡ ከሃዲ፡ “How the infidel Alexander’s neck was injured”.

miniature.info: Fol.40r: Cyricus and Julitta in pitch (?).
Fol. 41v: Cyricus and Julitta receiving the Covenant from the Lord.
miniature.details: Legend: ዘከመ፡ ወሀቦ፡ ኪዲነ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወለእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ እግዚእነ። “How our Lord gave the Covenant to Saint Cyricus and his mother Julitta”.

miniature.info: Fol. 43r: Beheading of Cyricus and Julitta and their crowning (above); the donor Däğğazmač Säbagadis (below).
miniature.details: Legend (above): ዘከመ፡ ተመትረ፡ ክሣዶሙ፡ ለቅዱስ፡ ቂርቆስ፡ ወለእሙ፡ ኢየሉጣ፡ “How the neck of Saint Cyricus and his mother Julitta was cut”. Legend (below): ዘከመ፡ ተማኅፀነ፡ ደጅ፡ አዝማች፡ ሰባ፡ ጋዲስ፡ መኰንነ፡ መኳንንት፡ መስፍነ፡ መሳፍንት፡ አግዚአብሔር፡ ይዕቀብከ፡ እምዓይነ፡ ሞት፡ አሜን። “How däğğazmač Säbagadis, governor of the governors, ruler of the rulers, received in trust, so that the Lord might protect you from the eye of the death. Amen”.
